intro: Cynophalla mattogrossensis, commonly known as the Brazilian burrplant, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, thistle-like appearance. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is often found in grasslands and disturbed soils. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
